caption: Hidden gem in park slope. The food was really tasty. Very good selections of wine. The staff was so friendly.
Hands down the best restaurant on the whole of 5th - you’ll be eating long after your appetite is sated- a must for any foodies looking for the best in afro French cuisine

This is my new favorite place in Brooklyn. The grilled fish (branzino) with plantains were perfect. For those looking for a more traditional West African meal, we were able to arrange a traditional Cameroonian meal with the chef in advance (Grilled fish, plantains, cassava, greens and peanut sauce with an incredible hot sauce).

I went to Le Succulent a year ago because my friend told me that the owner was Cameroonian and a lot of my Peace Corps friends missed Cameroonian cooking from their experience. We ordered French food, which we enjoyed a lot. We ended up talking to the owner, Melanie, who was absolutely wonderful. She confirmed that she is from Cameroon and told us we just needed to make sure to call ahead if we needed to her to prepare Cameroonian dishes so she can get the ingredients ahead of time. A small group of us finally got together a year later, called her to see if she had ingredients for poisson braise and piment. She didn't know if she had ingredients for baton de manioc and ndole. As soon as she said yes to the former, we power walked over to her restaurant in 40 minutes. She ended up surprising us with the ndole and baton de manioc which made all of us very happy the day after Thanksgiving. Her cooking was excellent, and you can tell she used quality ingredients in her cooking that made her food stand out. I am so excited to have this restaurant nearby!
I had the Chuben Jen dish! Loved it. Chef Melanie Delacourt is so charming. It was a pleasure to meet her. I will be back to try the Yassa dish!
Limited seating and small menu, but do you need a big menu when everything is sooo good! Amazing fusion of French and African, flavors spot on. Service was excellent!
(Translated by Google) Ekdm bekr h bc  (Original) Ekdm bekr h bc
Really helpful and nice staff, very welcoming. Food was delicious!
Nice place and delicious scrumptious dishes. Beautiful atmosphere.

My husband and I had the pleasure of dining at Le Succulent a few months ago, and this place was really special. The food was unlike anything we had had in Brooklyn before, the drinks were unique, homemade, and vibrant, and the service was warm and familiar. We're so happy to see that they've set up an outdoor space and have started doing delivery as well. They're a neighborhood spot that we hope stay around for a very, very long time. Just the best!

Amazing food and great service!   We ordered: -truffle fries -hanger steak -Yassa chicken  Truffle fries were perfectly salted with a rich truffle flavor-melt in your mouth Steak was also perfectly seasoned, juicy, and tender Chicken was delicious too, with this very flavorful rice!  Everything melted in your mouth. We didn’t want the meal to end and definitely can’t wait to go back and try everything else!
Food is really unique and tasty every time. And the couple who run the restaurant are fun to chat with. A must for anyone who likes inventive takes on French cuisine!
Fantastic place, the food is great and the couple running this place are really friendly.

Wonderfully prepared food. A husband and wife who run it all and though it takes a bit to arrive the food shows a level of dedication that you can taste in every bite. Filling of the soul and stomach, a gustatory delight to be seated here

This place is my favorite place.  Of all restaurants I know I prefere it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to visit this restaurant. everytime  I I need a proper meal, this place comes instantly to my head. good and varied  food and a large menu.generous team, and great mood. Not less important, the tariff is modest. I tell about this restaurant with pleasure.

We have dined in here a couple of times, but more recently we have been getting a lot of takeout from Le Succulent. Their food is always so delicious. We love the Chicken Yassa and the Burger. They never disappoint!
Lovely staff and very good food. We had a delicious meal.
This spot is worth visiting. They serve big portions for reasonable prices. Constantly neat and with awesome atmosphere. Would recommend to others.
Amazing place! Perfectly cooked creative dishes. Female chef! ❤️

My favorite restaurant in park slope! I’ve tried so many places in the area and the food here was so flavorful and unique, I just wish I discovered it sooner. And the owners are amazing and cook with such passion, I just loved every minute of my experience. Highly recommend!
Cute, quaint cafe, perfect for a late brunch. Service wasn't the greatest, but food more than made up for it.
Amazing coffee- it’s the French style where the coffee is super dark and they give you heated milk/ cream for you to mix on your own. 😍😍😍

The food is good, and the woman behind it seems beyond lovely. When we went though they didn’t have many of the beers, wines, and food items on the list and they messed up my friends order (medium rare, no onions) by cooking it well done with onions on top. When she asked to have it fixed they initially told her it was fine and “only cooked for 5 minutes.”  They eventually agreed to fix it but it shouldn’t be that much of a to-do frankly. I do hope they work out their kinks and succeed though — it is a special concept with a compelling backstory.

Wowed by this restaurant. Came here for a work lunch during the week, and the chef actually took our order (very cool) and was extremely friendly and accommodating. She ended up making dishes for us off of the dinner menu upon our request. Not to mention, the food was cooked perfectly. Everything we ordered was delicious. I highly recommend enjoying any meal here!

Food is very good. Service is a bit slow with o e person but it was very friendly. Was first time but will go hack. Had the African fish which was really good. A little salty. Beet appy was amazing. Wine very reasonable
Terrible service. They were out of chicken and waffles at 1pm for their brunch menu. Long wait.

I ate at Le Succulent on a Friday night.  I had the Thieboudienne and it was delicious. The fish was perfectly seasoned and cooked.  The joloff rice and stewed cabbage, eggplant and carrot could be a meal alone.  They’re all perfectly cooked and delicious.  My partner had the salmon burger and it was a salmon filet with cheese and he said he’d definitely come back for that.   His sandwich was tasty to me but the fries were PERFECT!! (Crispy outside firm but doughy inside).  I cant wait to go back!

It’s a great restaurant. Owned by chef and her husband. They are the loviest French couple making Afro-French cuisine. If you want to go a little hide out and enjoy a quiet dinner this is. It has a beautiful charm! I had this beautiful drink called BISSAP it’s a hibiscus with mint + vanilla.

They were out of nearly half the items on the menu. Service was very unpolished. It took over an hour for our appetizer and 1 hour and a half for entrees. Prices are very high for the quality, presentation, and ambiance. When looking for a nice, quality meal on a Saturday night this was disappointing on every level. Will not be going back.
Long wait, bad service, and just simply bad food. Very disappointing.
Not cheap but food was excellent

My family and I went to Le Succulent for Thanksgiving dinner and I think we have a new holiday tradition. The food was amazing. I highly recommend the cod croquettes and the pork chop. Any you cant go wrong with any dish that comes with the deliciously garlic brussel sprouts! The chef even prepared special vegan dishes for my brother which he raved about. See ya next year!  Sent from Outlook

Service was just really slow, and the food was...fine. I had the chicken and waffles, and the waffles were dry and tough. Two parties ended up leaving because they never got water after sitting for about 10 minutes. We should have, as well. When we got there, we were the third table, and we were told by the server that he'll be right here...about 5 times. Well, you win some, and you lose some.
Friendly service and high quality food

DISTINCTIVE AND FLAVORFUL, the food on a cold night in November was warming, soothing and somehow like home cooking, even though I had never before encountered Afro-French cuisine. A lamb dish came with a gently spiced sauce and mashed potatoes: appetizers included savory beignets unlike the sugared bombs in New Orleans and outperformed. Our server was gracious and attentive. Prices are not a bargain but diners may bring their own wine and beer. We will return.
Love this place. Tasty food, very nice and friendly service.
friendly staff
The chicken wassa and fish ceeebu jen were delicious. My 2 daughters 2 and 4 loved it :-) Thank you to the chef Melanie!
Great African French cuisine. Very intimate.

The food itself is excellent ... as good as any top French restaurant. Service is also very good and friendly.  Prices are reasonable. More variety of dishes and drinks coming shortly.  Excellent small cozy restaurant. I would recommend it.

Delightful French-Senegalese cuisine at extremely reasonable prices with very friendly service.  If you want a great Sunday brunch that takes walk-ins with no wait in a neighbourhood that generally requires booking ahead, come here.  Had the fantastic Crepe Succulent, filled with smoked salmon, mushrooms, and mornay sauce and topped by delightful greens, along with the hibiscus-based bissap juice. Bill came to just over 20 bucks, delivering great quality at price that’s hard to beat in the neighbourhood. All-around amazing!
Food was fantastic. Order the Yassa with Chicken. Vibe is very nice. Service was honestly top notch. Would recommend for a different and unique food experience.
Had a great dinner. Delicious food! Great service!

Tried this French/African place for the first time tonight and it was great all around. It's a small operation, but can definitely hold it's own among the other restaurants on 5th ave. It's definitely the most interesting food in the area right now (if you're tired of the Italian/Thai/Mexican/Sushi dinner rotation like we are).  The Chef is from Cameroon but trained in France. The food is delicious- wonderfully interesting spices, sophisticated but not pretentious. And it has the feel of a neighborhood joint in some non-nyc location (the waiter was super nice and made an effort to learn our names).  What we loved: - Grapefruit, shrimp, and arugula salad - Yassa w/chicken - Chebu Jen  If you have room for desert, try the Snow Egg.  We will definitely be going back.
Great new neighborhood restaurant!
Food is fantastic, service is friendly and food is some of the best in the neighborhood, hands down! BYOB is a plus!

An excellent restaurant for brunch, lunch and dinner, offering west African/French fusion cuisine for those seeking something new, and familiar dishes like crepes and omelettes for those seeking something more familiar. I have been twice and will return for sure. Recommend.
Excellent dishes, great atmosphere. Highly recommend
Delicious brunch. Authentic French cuisine. Crepes and croques are so good. Service spot on. Can't wait to go for dinner!

Recently had the pleasure of enjoying a very tasty meal at Le Succulent. The appetizers were recommended and along with hubby's braised branzino , my yassa chicken, finishing with snow egg dessert, it was all good.  We will return.  Chef Melanie, well done.
Foods are flavorful and different than what you think., Especially "Chicken with waffle" but not much varieties.  The servers are super nice and helpful.
(Translated by Google) Succulent is actualy succulent!  (Original) Le Succulent is actualy succulent !
(Translated by Google) Excellent restaurant!  (Original) Excellent restaurant!
Amazing brunch entrees and great service! Will definitely be coming back.

Wonderful addition to park slope. Always love a menu where I end up ordering a number of things I've never had before. Really nice flavors and a pleasant staff. Currently low key BYOB. Apparently has good coffee and crepes in the morning. Worth checking out if you're into African/French food.

Popped into Le Succulent last week for date night after walking by and browsing the menu. I had the braised fish as the description seemed similar to a dish that I love at cafe rue dix, but this couldn’t compare. The fish was cooked well but wasn’t as flavorful as I expected and the plantains were dry. My girlfriend got the Chichen Alloco and found it to simply not have been prepared as she’d expected with the chicken being served in chunks and not minced. The Brocolli and Brussel sprouts were ok. Service was fine but the server seemed to think that I needed to enter my pin for the transaction which was atypical for a dining transaction.

Le Succulent is awesome! It has a nice vibe for just about anyone who is looking to relax and catch up with some friends or even take someone here on a date. The food is amazing (highly recommend the French Toast) and price is very reasonable. I actually had both lunch and dinner there the same day since it was really good. I highly recommend having a crepe to top off your meal. For dinner, there was some legit African dishes. Highly recommend it for anyone who is looking to try something new. The owners of the restaurant are super friendly and I enjoyed learning about their background and culture. Try it out and enjoy it. :)

I’ve been to this cute little spot the last 2 times I was in New York and I haven’t left disappointed. The breakfast was amazing and the dinner was the perfect portion size. The food isn’t missing an ounce of flavor and the ambience is perfect to kick back and relax. The salmon is my favorite dish for dinner..it’s so moist on the inside with the perfect amount of crisp on the outside, just how I like it. The waiter was one of the nicest people ever and made sure I had everything I needed. I have also had the desserts and drinks and they are also super flavorful and authentic! My favorite one was the African ginger drink..you have to try this! To say the least, I will be back here on my next trip to the city. If you are considering...you won’t regret the trip!

I hesitate to rate a place I have only been to once, but this little restaurant has been open less than two months so I'm glad to get the word out. I had the salmon, it was excellent. The chef clearly cares about food. I wish I was going to be visiting Brooklyn longer so I could try more items on the small but well thought out menu. Friendly and considerate service, too.

We only stopped in for dessert and tea , but we were pleasantly surprised by wonderfully friendly service , a delicious chocolate mouse and fantastic tea selection served in a pot with a hot water refill ! The art on the walls was worth the trip. Looking forward to returning with a full appetite!
Melanie (chef/owner) is so sweet! And every dish was beautiful prepared and delicious. Especially loved the appetizers. This is a great new addition to the neighborhood.
The food here is second to none.  And the prices are definitely reasonable.  NY definitely has a lot to offer and you should add this gem of a restaurant to your list of places to try out .

If you’re looking for a great French restaurant without overpaying and still leaving hungry, i HIGHLY recommend this place. From the ambiance to the menu to the actual food itself, Le Succulent is great across the board. It’s now my go to place whenever I am in Brooklynn.

I was in town, from D.C., and had to see the restaurant with my own eyes. The food was delightful and the service was great! The Chefs and owners came out to check on us during our meal, which always means a lot. Mercí beaucoup.  P.s. the pavé de saumon avec salade de quinoa avocat is a must have! And the deserts too.
Great atmosphere and delicious food. Staff is very friendly and welcoming!
The food, atmosphere, and service were all wonderful! Would definitely recommend to anyone nearby

A-ma-zing place ! If you’re looking for either french cuisine or just a cool and friendly restaurant : you have your answer. Mélanie the chef is as welcoming as her food is delicious. From the crêpes to the main courses, make sure to try as much dishes as possible, you’ll love it

The food was so delicious. We felt like we were getting a homemade authentically French meal for a fraction of a fancy Manhattan French restaurant price. Melanie the owner is LOVELY and all of us in the community should support this restaurant!

I actually had more food but I couldn't wait to taste it. It was an amazing experience! Supporting local busniess! It is those French restaurant that you don't need to over paid and have a great taste of food! I really recommend this place!  And finally I remembered to take a picture of this and share this place with everyone !!

We had a very good experience here during the soft opening. We had the quiche Lorraine, a crepe and chocolate mousse. The quiche and mousse were outstanding. The crepe was very good. The owner/chef was very nice. We look forward to coming back and trying the expanded menu.

Brand new restaurant in Park Slope. We had a lovely and memorable experience. We ordered one of everything on the menu and everything was delicious!  Our 8 and 5 year old kids agreed. Chef/owner Melanie was super friendly and welcoming. We will be back (often)!
